summary: A guide to building a customer support email agent with LangGraph, covering workflow mapping, node design, state management, and implementation.

structure.title: Thinking in LangGraph
structure.summary: A guide to building a customer support email agent with LangGraph, covering workflow mapping, node design, state management, and implementation.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Start with the process you want to automate
nodes.title: Start with the process you want to automate
nodes.summary: Describes the process of building a customer support email AI agent with requirements like reading emails, classifying urgency, searching documentation, drafting responses, escalating issues, and scheduling follow-ups, along with example scenarios.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 1: Map out your workflow as discrete steps
nodes.title: Step 1: Map out your workflow as discrete steps
nodes.summary: Describes the initial step of designing a LangGraph workflow: identifying discrete steps as nodes and mapping their connections, using an email processing example.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 2: Identify what each step needs to do
nodes.title: Step 2: Identify what each step needs to do
nodes.summary: Identifies four types of nodes in LangGraph: LLM steps for text generation, Data steps for retrieval, Action steps for external actions, and User input steps for human intervention.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 2: Identify what each step needs to do > LLM steps
nodes.title: LLM steps
nodes.summary: Describes LLM steps for classifying intent and drafting replies in LangGraph, detailing static/dynamic contexts and desired outcomes.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 2: Identify what each step needs to do > Data steps
nodes.title: Data steps
nodes.summary: Describes data retrieval steps in LangGraph, including document search and customer history lookup, detailing parameters, retry strategies, and caching mechanisms.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 2: Identify what each step needs to do > Action steps
nodes.title: Action steps
nodes.summary: Describes action steps in LangGraph for external actions: sending replies after approval and bug tracking with retry strategies.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 2: Identify what each step needs to do > User input steps
nodes.title: User input steps
nodes.summary: Describes the human review node in LangGraph, including its context, input format, and triggering conditions.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 3: Design your state
nodes.title: Step 3: Design your state
nodes.summary: Guidelines for designing agent state: determining what data to include and advocating for storing raw data with on-demand prompt formatting.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 3: Design your state > What belongs in state?
nodes.title: What belongs in state?
nodes.summary: Guidelines for determining what data to include in state: persist across steps, avoid storing derivable data, and examples for an email agent.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 3: Design your state > Keep state raw, format prompts on-demand
nodes.title: Keep state raw, format prompts on-demand
nodes.summary: Advocates storing raw data in state and formatting prompts within nodes for flexibility, clarity, and maintainability in agent design.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 4: Build your nodes
nodes.title: Step 4: Build your nodes
nodes.summary: Implements LangGraph nodes as Python functions for state updates, covering error handling strategies and email agent node implementation.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 4: Build your nodes > Handle errors appropriately
nodes.title: Handle errors appropriately
nodes.summary: A guide to error handling strategies in LangGraph, covering transient, LLM-recoverable, user-fixable, and unexpected errors with corresponding code examples.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 4: Build your nodes > Implementing our email agent nodes
nodes.title: Implementing our email agent nodes
nodes.summary: Implements email agent nodes in LangGraph for reading, classifying, searching, drafting, and sending email responses, including human review.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 5: Wire it together
nodes.title: Step 5: Wire it together
nodes.summary: Connects nodes into a LangGraph workflow with error handling and checkpointer for human-in-the-loop interrupts, enabling state persistence.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Step 5: Wire it together > Try out your agent
nodes.title: Try out your agent
nodes.summary: Demonstrates testing an agent with an urgent billing issue, showing how the graph pauses for human review and resumes with input.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Summary and next steps
nodes.title: Summary and next steps
nodes.summary: Summarizes key insights and advanced considerations for building LangGraph agents, and introduces next steps for extending agents with advanced features.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Summary and next steps > Key Insights
nodes.title: Key Insights
nodes.summary: Key insights from building an email agent with LangGraph: break workflows into discrete steps, use shared state, treat nodes as functions, handle errors as part of flow, prioritize human input, and let graph structure emerge naturally.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Summary and next steps > Advanced considerations
nodes.title: Advanced considerations
nodes.summary: Discusses trade-offs in node granularity design in LangGraph, focusing on resilience, observability, and performance considerations for workflow nodes.

nodes.path: thinking-in-langgraph > Thinking in LangGraph > Summary and next steps > Where to go from here
nodes.title: Where to go from here
nodes.summary: Introduction to extending LangGraph agents with advanced features like human-in-the-loop patterns, subgraphs, streaming, observability, tool integration, and retry logic.
